message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.CC 

The paper deals with regenerating codes, which are a type of coding scheme used in distributed storage systems. This topic falls under the intersection of several computer science subfields, including information theory (cs.IT), distributed systems (cs.DS), signal processing (cs.SI), networked systems (cs.NI), and computational complexity (cs.CC). Given that the paper focuses on the construction of regenerating codes and their performance, cs.IT and cs.DS are the most likely categories. However, since the paper also discusses implementation and practical considerations, cs.SI, cs.NI, and cs.CC are also relevant subfields.
